The probability of a product being high-quality is 28.57% (2 high-quality products out of 7 total products). When we update this probability with the new information that the previous product was low-quality, we use Bayes' theorem. The updated probability of this product being high-quality is calculated as: P(high-quality) = (P(high-quality) * P(low-quality | high-quality)) / (P(high-quality) * P(low-quality | high-quality) + P(low-quality) * P(high-quality | low-quality)). Plugging in the numbers, we get: P(high-quality) = (0.2857 * 0.4286) / (0.2857 * 0.4286 + 0.7143 * 0.2857) = 0.2381 or 23.81%. This product is still available for $100.
